title: Living.Door
Living.Enter
body:
Oh! This is my living room! I was in my own closet the whole time! Silly me!

...

...

OH MY GOD THIS ROOM IS ON FIRE!!!

MY WALLSCROLLS!!!

MY ANIME FIGURINES!!!

MY COMPUTER!!!!!!!!

I AM GOING TO BURN TO DEATH IN THREE MINUTES I GOTTA GET OUT OF HERE!!!

<<start timer>>

<<if visited("Living.Tutorial_Ending") is false>>
    // uncomment when choices work.
    // [[Living.Tutorial]]
<<endif>>

title: Living.Tutorial
body:
But this is my first time walking around the living room in a little bit, maybe I should recall my "tutorial" training...

-> I DON'T HAVE TIME FOR THIS MY HAIR IS ON FIRE
    I DON'T HAVE TIME FOR THIS!!! 
    I NEED TO MAKE TIME!
    HRRRRRRGGGGGGGGG!!!!!!!!!
    <<add timer -10>>
    SHIT I GOT HOTTER, NOT COOLER
    HRRRRRRGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGG!!!!!!!!!
    <<add timer 5>>
    GOOD ENOUGH
-> THE FUNDAMENTALS ARE IMPORTANT EVEN IN TIMES OF DISTRESS
    THAT'S RIGHT! WE NEED TO REVIEW!

First, I should remember how to get around here.
I believe if I were to imagine a "mouse cursor", and place that cursor at the end of my vision...
My perspective might "scroll" to include more scenery in that direction.
But what if I want to call attention to some object?
Hovering this "mouse cursor" over the item and "clicking" on the item ought to solve this.
Hmm, I think that's it for now!
Uh, what was I doing again?
...
...
...
...
...
...
...
...
...
OH RIGHT, GET OUT OF THIS ROOM!
LET'S GO!!!

// Give control for 5 seconds, then die. Tutorial ending.

title: Living.Tutorial_Ending
Living.Door_BruteForce
body:
// Gonna need to figure out how to define this initially, 
// or if undefined ints are just zero
<<if $door_count is null>>
    <<set $door_count to 0>>
    <<set $bang = "*bang*">>
<<endif>>

<<set $door_count to $door_count + 1>>


<<if $door_count is 1>>
    What's up with this door? I can't open it!
    Is this the exit?
<<elseif $door_count is 2>>
    *bang* *bang*
    I don't think I can open it!
<<elseif $door_count is 3>>
    I mean, the wheel itself turns, but there's a padlock on it!
<<elseif $door_count is 4>>
    Would staring at the door work? Could that unlock its mysteries?
<<elseif $door_count is 5>>
    PLEASE OPEN, DOOR! I'M BEGGING YOU!!!

<<elseif $door_count >= 25>>
    Oh, I think it's open now. Easy peasy.
<<elseif $door_count >= 6>>
    <<set $bang = $bang + " *bang*">>
$bang
<<endif>>

title: Living.Olaf
body:
There appears to be a poorly constructed snowman inside this refridgerator.

Olaf: Hello! I am Olaf the Snowman from the animated children's film <u>Walt Disney's Frozen</u>! I am a trademarked character loved by all children!
Olaf: I am especially loved the children under 5. My core demographic.

Why are you in my refridgerator?

Olaf: Disney Magic!

You knocked all my food out to make room for your snow man body!

Olaf: Step off! You're not a cop!
Olaf: Have you seen <u>Walt Disney's Frozen</u>? Did you watch it to the end?

-> Yes
    Wonderful! Here's a gun!
-> No
    Olaf: Let's watch it to the end! I have a portable film player inside of my snowy flesh!
    // FROZEN ENDING. You die watching Frozen. Olaf holds you tight enough to keep you alive during the full runtime. You die at the credits.
-> Eat the snowman
    // This could tie into the brute force ending, making the puzzle getting enough time from eating frozen items.
    I eat the snow man. All the frozen snowman flesh in my belly adds a whopping 5 minutes to the timer.
    The snow man cried out "Don't eat me! I'm a living snow man!" 125 times, the length in seconds of his song titled "In Summer" from the film, Frozen.
    But that didn't stop me!

title: Living.Computer
body:
<<if $computer_power is true>>
    [[Living.Computer_Use]]
<<endif>>


<<if $checked_computer is false>>

It's my computer desk! My computer appears to be powered off.

No problem for me, though!

<<endif>>

*click*

...

What the heck?!? It's not turning on!

<<set $checked_computer to 1>>

title: Living.Computer_Plug
body:
<<if $checked_computer is true>>
Aha! Oh course! The computer was not plugged in!
<<else>>
My computer isn't plugged in. I should fix that.
<<endif>>

<<set $computer_power to 1>>
// Change sprite to plugged in

title: Living.Computer_Use
body:
Now, what do I do with what little time I have left?

-> Order a Pizza from Dominos
    [[Living.Pizza_Ending]]
-> Watch Bee Movie but sped up to $time_remaining minutes
    Bee Ending

title: Living.ThisIsFine
body:
<<if visited("Living.ThisIsFine")>>
A completely original dog is seated at the dining room table.
His little hat is caught in the blaze.

Dog: ...
Dog: ...

The dog clears his throat.

Dog: This is fine.
Dog: I'm okay with the events that are unfolding currently.
The dog takes a sip of coffee. His arm singed by the blaze.
Dog: That's okay, thinkgs are going to be okay.
The dogs face starts to melt.

Dog: ...

Dog: Theft is not a joke.
<<else>>
Dog: This is fine.
<<endif>>

title: Living.ThisIsNotFine
body:
The competely original dog sits at the dining room table.
Dog: Th-
The dog clears his throat.
Dog: THIS IS NOT FINE!!!
Dog: ON MY GOD EVERYTHINGS ON FIRE
Dog: WHAT THE HELL IS MY PROBLEM???
Dog: OH MY GOD JESUS FUCK
Dog: WHAT THE FUCK WAS I EVEN THINKING?
The dog produces a fire extinguisher and begins putting out all the fires.
Dog: THERE WAS NO REASON TO LET IT LAST THIS LONG AND GET THIS BAD
Dog: THEY SHOT A GORILLA FOR GODSSAKE

...

The fires have been put out, and your livingroom is now a charred mess.

title: Living.Pizza_Ending
body:
That's it! I can order a pizza from Dominos and tell them to call the fire department in the delivery instructions!!!
Let's just add a one-topping large pepperoni to the cart...
Enter my payment information...
And... submit! Here goes nothing!
// Show a pizza tracker graphic as it slowly makes the pizza
<<await play PizzaTracker>>
*knock knock*
They're here!
HEY! HEY! DID YOU BRING THE POLICE? I CAN'T OPEN THIS DOOR!
<s>Uh, no</s>
IT WAS IN THE DELIVERY INSTRUCTIONS!!!
<s>I didn't read those. Hold on.</s>
// X out pizza tracker and draw in police tracker. It finishes at 0:01.
<<await play PoliceTracker>>
Suddenly, the door was kicked open!
You made it officer, I'm saved!
Cop: Yeah, from hunger!
// go sepia, laugh track, roll credits, pizza ending

title: Living.Time_Ran_Out
body:
I'm out of time. And oxygen. The fire used it all up.
I fell on the ground, covered in fire.
This is the end for me.

// Out of time
